Security Profile Statement: The system is equipped to maximize the duration and viability of essential business functions during adversity (Continue)
The system is capable to preclude the successful execution of an attack or the realization of adverse conditions (Prevent/Avoid)
The system can restore as much business functionality as possible subsequent to adversity (Reconstitute)
The ICS system is segmented from enterprise IT networks
The ICS system is protected from unauthorized physical access, tampering, and theft
ICS safety functions are integrated with cybersecurity controls
All ICS devices and software are maintained with up-to-date security patches
Remote access to ICS is controlled and monitored
ICS systems use multi-factor authentication for critical operations
ICS cybersecurity policies and procedures are documented and reviewed annually
ICS cybersecurity risk assessments are performed at least annually
Business continuity and disaster recovery plans are established and tested for ICS
ICS operators receive specialised operational security training
The organisation maintains a process to identify and address human factors in ICS security
Management demonstrates commitment to the security program through resource allocation and oversight
